Package View

Class DrawnMap.MouseState

java.lang.Object
View.DrawnMap.MouseState
All Implemented Interfaces:
MouseListener, MouseMotionListener, MouseWheelListener, EventListener, MouseInputListener
Enclosing class:
DrawnMap
public class DrawnMap.MouseState extends Object implements MouseInputListener, MouseWheelListener
MouseState is MouseListener class that defines new classes for the methods used A MouseState is composed of:
  • A boolean that indicates if the the mouse is pressed
  • A boolean that indicates if the the mouse is released
  • A float that indicate the x-axis position of the mouse on the screen
  • A float that indicate the y-axis position of the mouse on the screen
  • A boolean that indicates if a segment is selected
  • A boolean that indicates if an intersection is selected
  • A boolean that indicates if we are performing a zoom
MouseState is created to be an attribute of the DrawnMap class, and serve as it's own MouseListener. MouseState inherits MouseInputListener and MouseWheelListener, in order to get the behavior of the mouse in the panel.
Author:
H4122
See Also:
Intersection, Segment, DrawnMap, Controller.parseMap(org.w3c.dom.Document)
